alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Oconee; Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued February 27 at 6:22PM EST until February 27 at 6:45PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina... Central Pickens County in Upstate South Carolina... East central Oconee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 645 PM EST. * At 621 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Seneca, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Central, Six Mile and Pendleton around 630 PM EST. Easley, Liberty and Norris around 640 PM EST. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
